title: SaveAs Forgets the file type
description: When using the SaveAs feature in the application, the file type is not remembered. Additionally, the icon associated with the saved file has changed from the parent java file icon to a generic file icon.
OB: After performing the steps mentioned below, the file is saved without an extension and the file icon is displayed as a generic file icon instead of the previous java file icon.
EB: After performing the steps mentioned below, the file should be saved with the appropriate file extension and the file icon should remain the same as the parent java file icon.
SR:
1) Open an existing java file.
2) Modify the file (e.g., move an existing class).
3) Click on the SaveAs icon located next to the Save Icon.
4) A dialog box will appear.
5) Browse for a valid container location.
6) Enter the filename without specifying the file extension (as it is not requested).
7) Click Ok.

Observe that the Navigator has added the file in the specified location, but with no file extension shown. The file icon should remain the same as the parent java file icon.
